com.ftdichip.ftd2xx
Class DeviceDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.DeviceDescriptor
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeviceDescriptorRev4, DeviceDescriptorRev5
public class DeviceDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object

Stores all data, describing a particular device. This data is stored within the EEPROM and can be written as well. For a detailed description of the date see FTD`s publications.

Note: This DeviceDescriptor stores only the data common to all devices, old and new ones. Data that is only available for newer devices is specified by particular sub-classes.

For a more detailed description of the fields see the ftd2xx-API specification.

Author:
Mike Werner

Constructor Detail

DeviceDescriptor

public DeviceDescriptor()
Method Detail

validate

protected void validate()
                 throws InvalidDeviceDescriptorException
Checks if this device descriptor is valid.

Throws:
InvalidDeviceDescriptorException - if the total number of characters for manufacturer, manufacturerID, description and serialNumber is greater than 48.
